text: {{Infobox writer | name = Anthony Browne | image = Anthony Browne November 2010.JPG | caption = Browne in 2010 | birth_name = Anthony Edward Browne | birth_date = | birth_place = Sheffield, Yorkshire, England | nationality = British | children = 2 | occupation = Illustrator, writer | period = 1976–present | genre = Children's picture books | subject = | notableworks = Gorilla | awards = | website =www.anthonybrownebooks.com }} Anthony Edward Tudor Browne (born 11 September 1946) is a British writer and illustrator of children's books, mainly picture books, with nearly forty titles to his name. For his lasting contribution as a children's illustrator he won the biennial, international Hans Christian Andersen Award in 2000. From 2009 to 2011 he was Children's Laureate. ==References== ==Other websites== * Anthony Browne Personal website * * Anthony Browne index at The Guardian —includes one Gallery (14 pictures) * Anthony Browne at Children's Book Illustration —with extensive Gallery Category:1946 births Category:Living people Category:English children's writers Category:Writers from Sheffield
